newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary snowfalls no danger to crops - Met Office.
newsitem.headline: Hungary snowfalls no danger to crops - Met Office.

text.p: Recent snowfalls and cold weather are more good news than bad for Hungary's agriculture, the Meteorological Office (OMSZ) said on Wednesday.
"Much-needed precipitation would more than offset the possible growth delay caused by recent and expected snowfalls," Attila Bussay of the OMSZ's agricultural department told Reuters.
Hungary's weather turned colder over the weekend and snowfalls that started on Tuesday are forecast to last until the end of the month, he said.
Bussay added that the snow was likely to have a beneficial effect as an early drought had already prompted the Agriculture Ministry to impose a fire ban at the beginning of March.
